txt.en: Talk to Bingo on the banks of the Brandywine
Cheer on Bingo while he finds the perfect spot
Talk to Bingo on the banks of the Brandywine
'What if [placeholder] swims across and shows you how, Bingo?'
'What if [placeholder] goes first? Would that help?'
Bingo is ready to learn to swim, and needs your advice.
'What is he doing?'
'[placeholder] could go first!'
'What if someone swam across first, as a demonstration?'
'I am drenched, but I am happy, my friend. Let us return to the Golden Perch and dry off!'
'Stop! I can't bear to look!'
DNT - Blah!
'Well, here we are, [placeholder]. Time for this hobbit to learn a new skill!'
DNT - Blah!
In preparation for his journey, you have come down to the banks of the Brandywine to help Bingo learn to swim.

'It occurs to me that I may have made a slight error in judgement, [placeholder], and I have perhaps not dressed entirely appropriately for the... cold... frigid... waters...'

Bingo shivers.

'What do you think? Do you think perhaps I just need to warm myself up? Possibly get the blood flowing? That is a capital idea, my intelligent [placeholder] friend!'
Perhaps leading by example will help. If you swim across the river yourself, perhaps Bingo will find it within himself to do the same.
You should return to Bingo and see if your demonstration helped him gain some confidence.
'I am a bit warmer, but the water still looks cold and now I just feel tired!\n\n'You think maybe this is just a bad spot? Maybe I should try another place on the bank? Good idea!'
'That was incredible, my friend! If you can do it, I certainly think I can do it as well!'
Provide support for Bingo as he prepares to swim
Your muscles ache, but you have put on a fine demonstration
Bingo splashed around some in the water. It is possible there might have been a little swimming in there, but it is hard to say for certain.
'I did it, [placeholder]! Did you see me? Your feat was pretty good, but I'm afraid my own may have shown you up some.\n\n'Now that was a true display of swimming prowess, wouldn't you say?'
Stay out of Bingo's way while he warms himself up
Rosa
Lily
Bingo is ready to learn to swim, and needs your advice.
Bingo is ready to learn to swim, and needs your advice.
'All right....'
'Has the Brandywine always looked this wide?'
'It looks cold, too. Does it look cold to you?'
'Is he really going to try and swim?'
'[placeholder], might I have a word?'
'That was just the thing!'
'I was wrong, I'm not ready.'
'[placeholder], I need you!'
'Look at him go!'
'You're doing it, Bingo!'
Everard
'He has gone mad!'
'Oh my!'
'Patience, everyone. I am almost all set!'
'Aaaah!'
'Here I go!'
'Maybe here will be better.'
'I don't know....'
'Yes, that might do it! I will watch you swim, my adventuring friend!'
'I'm swimming! I'm swimming!'
Talk to Bingo on the banks of the Brandywine
Mosco
Swim to the other side of the river
Talk to Bingo, but don't let him drip on you
Peony
Return to Bingo and see if your demonstration helped
'Hey! Aren't you supposed to be a good example for Bingo?'
'You're not supposed to take the bridge! You're supposed to swim!'
'Now get down there and get wet!'
Instance: Sink or Swim
'Why is this taking so long?'
'Seems like it, the poor fool!'
